page.title: 02HOLSWORTHY PANNIER MARKET
page.content: Holsworthy is a small market town whose Pannier market officially began in 1155.The market is held on Wednesdays throughout the year at an open air venue at the main square in Holsworthy.The stalls generally open at 8.00am and close at 4.00pm.The stall holders come from Holsworthy and other areas.Stall holders often attend other markets in the surrounding area. A questionaire showed that the public went to the Wednesday market because they thought it was reliable and cheap compared to the shops.To secure a stall one has to contact the Torridge District Council at its Bideford headquarters.It may take two years.The market which has approximately 25 stalls attracts much attention to the local people and tourists,selling such items as fresh foods,fruits and clothes.
